title: Underground Resistance Bunker Adventure #23
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Communications Room
rooms.description: A cramped underground room filled with radio equipment and blinking monitors. Maps of the city are pinned to concrete walls. Emergency lights cast a red glow over everything. The air smells of ozone and stale coffee. Cables snake across the floor, and a heavy steel door leads deeper into the bunker.

items.name: radio operator's desk
items.description: A metal desk covered with radio equipment, code books, and scattered papers

items.name: resistance journal
items.description: A worn notebook with daily entries from the resistance fighters
items.text: Day 47: Our bunker was established in 1944 when the occupation began. Commander Sarah leads us with courage. The armory holds our weapons, secured by those who know our mission. Remember: we fight for freedom, we hide in the underground, and our leader is Commander Sarah.

items.name: brass key
items.description: A small brass key with resistance symbols etched into it

items.name: tactical wall maps
items.description: Maps showing enemy positions and resistance safe houses
items.text: Strategic maps marked with red pins for enemy locations and blue pins for resistance cells. A note reads: 'Commander Sarah coordinates all operations from the command center. The underground network is our lifeline.'

items.name: metal supply locker
items.description: A tall locker containing supplies and equipment

items.name: battery powered flashlight
items.description: A heavy flashlight that still works

items.name: mission briefing document
items.description: A classified document outlining resistance operations
items.text: MISSION BRIEFING: Our resistance cell operates from this underground bunker. Commander Sarah has authorized access to the armory for trusted members. The steel door requires the silver key kept in the radio equipment cabinet.

items.name: radio equipment cabinet
items.description: A cabinet filled with radio gear and spare parts

items.name: silver key
items.description: A silver key labeled 'ARMORY ACCESS'

items.name: encryption code book
items.description: A book containing codes and ciphers used by the resistance
items.text: Resistance Code Book: All messages encrypted using standard protocols. Emergency code: 1944. Commander Sarah holds final authority on all operations. Our cause: freedom from tyranny.

items.name: reinforced steel door
items.description: A heavy steel door with a keyhole, leading to the armory. Resistance symbols are welded onto its surface.

rooms.name: Armory
rooms.description: A secure room lined with weapon racks and ammunition crates. The walls are reinforced concrete. Dim lights illuminate rows of rifles and supplies. A large safe sits in the corner. Beyond, a security door with an electronic keypad leads to the command center.

items.name: weapon rack
items.description: A rack holding various rifles and equipment

items.name: weapon cleaning kit
items.description: A kit for maintaining firearms

items.name: ammunition crate
items.description: A wooden crate stenciled with military markings

items.name: weapons inventory list
items.description: A detailed list of armory contents
items.text: ARMORY INVENTORY: 15 rifles, 200 rounds ammunition, 8 grenades, medical supplies. All equipment maintained by Sergeant Torres. Commander Sarah inspects weekly. Note: Command center access requires knowledge of our mission and leadership.

items.name: bulletin board
items.description: A board with photos and documents pinned to it
items.text: Photos of resistance members with names: Commander Sarah (Leader), Sergeant Torres (Armory), Maria (Communications), Josef (Explosives). Mission statement: 'We fight for freedom.' Location: Underground bunker network.

items.name: supply cabinet
items.description: A locked cabinet containing medical and survival supplies

items.name: first aid manual
items.description: A medical reference guide
items.text: Emergency medical procedures for resistance fighters. Remember: we operate underground, we fight for freedom, and Commander Sarah leads us all.

items.name: command center access card
items.description: A keycard for the command center security door

items.name: large safe
items.description: A heavy safe with resistance documents and supplies

items.name: commander's orders
items.description: Official orders from Commander Sarah
items.text: ORDERS FROM COMMANDER SARAH: The command center is our final refuge. Access requires verification of three truths: What do we fight for? Where do we operate? Who leads the resistance? Only those who know these answers may enter.

items.name: command center security door
items.description: A reinforced door with an electronic security panel displaying three verification questions.

password_questions.question: What do we fight for?
password_questions.hint: Check the resistance journal and mission documents

password_questions.question: Where do we operate?
password_questions.hint: Multiple documents mention the location of the bunker

password_questions.question: Who leads the resistance?
password_questions.hint: The journal, bulletin board, and orders all mention the leader

rooms.name: Command Center
rooms.description: You've reached the command center! A sophisticated room with multiple monitors showing city surveillance feeds. A large tactical table displays a map of the entire resistance network. Emergency exit signs glow green above a tunnel leading to safety. Fresh air flows from the escape route. You've made it to the heart of the resistance.

items.name: tactical planning table
items.description: A large table with maps and strategic planning materials

items.name: surveillance monitors
items.description: Multiple screens showing live feeds from across the city

items.name: emergency escape tunnel
items.description: A tunnel leading to safety outside the city
items.text: The tunnel is clear and leads to freedom. You can see daylight at the far end.

rooms.win_message: You've successfully reached the command center and secured the resistance bunker! The escape tunnel leads you safely out of the city. Your knowledge of the resistance's mission and leadership has proven your loyalty. The fight for freedom continues, but today you've won this battle. You win!
